function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Incomplete capture of relevant publications due to time limitations","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential bias in the literature review process due to authors’ idiosyncratic decisions","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inconsistency in the search process when collecting and identifying research papers","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limitation of search to peer-reviewed journals may exclude relevant literature and research output from other sources","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Fragility of global supply network exposed by covid-19 outbreaks","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of supply chain resilience and reach in operations","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Economic and social costs associated with isolation strategies","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased demand for specific goods and services during the pandemic","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Mandatory collective isolation i.e. ’social distancing’ has impacted consumer behavior and economic sectors.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High levels of uncertainty and instability in global supply chains","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of proper models for sustainable and effective distribution strategies","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Complexity of the supply chain due to globalisation","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Public places may become hotspots for disease transmission if ventilation rates are not maximized","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate scheduling and population distribution patterns in buildings may lead to increased infection risk","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Extended working hours and prolonged occupant presence in buildings can increase infection risk","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uniform population distribution pattern can reduce the number of infected people by up to 56%","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Optimal population distribution pattern in terms of energy consumption can reduce energy consumption by up to 32%","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Increasing ventilation rate in buildings reduces the number of infected people but increases HVAC energy consumption","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reducing class duration may result in a reduction of 49.6% in the number of infected people with COVID-19.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reducing class duration results in a 28% and 28.6% reduction in energy consumption in winter and summer, respectively.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The study identifies the impact of occupants, air exchange rate, class duration, and working hours on energy consumption and COVID-19 infection risk.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Extension of class duration may result in prolonged exposure time and higher risk of virus transmission.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Extended exposure time in spaces with infected people increases the risk of infection, despite virus particles deactivating over time.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Extending working hours of university buildings increases HVAC energy consumption and occupant presence, impacting COVID-19 transmission.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased air exchange rate may lead to higher energy consumption in the building.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of occupant distribution on COVID-19 transmission","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Affect of air exchange rate on energy consumption and virus transmission","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uneven population distribution in a building at certain hours of the day","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Poor alignment of occupant distribution with climatic conditions","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Low energy consumption patterns leading to specific occupancy levels","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Contagious disease propagation due to HVAC system malfunction or inefficiency","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Misinterpretation of optimization results leading to suboptimal decision-making","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Difficulty in accurately modeling COVID-19 virus infection due to indeterminate parameters and complex transmission mechanisms.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inaccurate validation of the mathematical model for estimating the number of infected people due to limited consideration of infection mechanisms.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Systematic errors bias in the model’s results due to inherent uncertainties and limitations in data inputs.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exponential relationship between quanta concentration and time, leading to higher virus particles with increased occupant density.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Release of virus particles into the air due to inhalation and exhalation","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Settling rate of virus particles on the ground","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inactivation rate of the virus in the environment","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased energy consumption by HVAC systems due to occupant density and variations in climate conditions","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Estimating COVID-19 infection risk based on virus quanta concentration and occupant density","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation and airflow control leading to increased risk of disease transmission","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inaccurate HVAC system settings potentially contributing to disease transmission","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overcrowding due to maximum number of occupants constraints","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation in classrooms","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Optimization model prioritizes energy consumption over disease spread","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for infection control in the optimization model","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation and air circulation in thermal zones","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Calculation of virus infection risk in built environments","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Uncertainty in virus quanta emission rate","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"}]}
